title: PORON Soft Seal 4701-15
content:
SRP has been a Preferred Converter for Rogers Corporationâ€™s PORON Polyurethane materials since 1999, including PORON Soft Seal 4701-15.

PORON 4701-15 soft seal series provides enhanced surface toughness and reliable, durable materials for use in thinner designs. Designed for superior dust sealing at 6lb/ft3, the PORON 4701-15 soft seal series is the lowest density offering in the PORON product line.
description: SRP is a Preferred Converter for PORON materials, and can convert PORON Soft Seal 4701-15 polyurethane into custom gaskets, seals and pads.

blocks.title: Applications

materials.title: Rogers PORON Polyurethane Foam
materials.content:
SRP converts PORON Polyurethane Foam materials to your custom gasket and seal requirements, and can be supplied with a pressure sensitive adhesive.

 

PORON Polyurethane Foams offer the following benefits:

  • Excellent compression set resistance, which enables durable, long-term performance for gasketing, sealing, and cushioning.
  • Low-outgassing and non-fogging, containing no plasticizers or residual chemicals to contaminate the device. The material will not become brittle and crumble and is non-corrosive to metal.
  • Inherently flame retardant without the use of additives. Many of the materials meet flammability requirements of UL HBF and MVSS 302.
  • Engineered urethane formulations offering a wide modulus range â€“ 2-90 psi @ 25% deflection â€“ for more design versatility requirements.
  • Good chemical resistance
  • Easy to fabricate, die-cuts cleanly and works with a broad range of adhesives
  • Broad range of formulas and thicknesses from 0.012â€³ to 0.500â€³ (0.43mm to 12.7mm)

Why Choose SRP for Custom Rogers PORON Polyurethane products?

Since 1951, SRP has served a number of industries. We supply gaskets, heat shields, insulators, isolators, and other related products to electronics, defense, energy, medical, transportation, microelectronics, and other industries. In addition to Rogers PORONÂ® microcellular polyurethanes, we also supplyÂ Rogers BISCO silicones. Both materials can be laminated with pressure sensitive adhesive for custom gasketing and sealing options for a wide array of industries. SRP is also aÂ Preferred Converter for Rogersâ€™s materials. Do you have questions about PORON Polyurethane? Feel free to contact us.
materials.description: SRP is a Preferred Converter for Rogers Corporations. We fabricate PORON Polyurethane materials into custom gaskets, seals, and pads.

suppliers.title: Rogers Corporation
suppliers.content:
SRP is proud to be a Rogers Corporation Preferred Converter for their line of PORONÂ® Polyurethane and BISCOÂ® Silicone materials.

The benefits of being a Rogers Corporation Preferred Converter:

  • Materials Access â€“ Access to high-performance products, including PORONÂ® materials, for our customers.
  • Employee Training â€“ We maintain our expertise through on-site training provided by Rogers Corporation.
  • Networking â€“ Using Rogersâ€™ extensive network allows us to work more efficiently in all areas of our business.
  • Extended Customer Benefits â€“ We receive discounts and favorable lead times, which we extend to our customers.
  • Support â€“ As a Preferred Converter, SRP is supported by a team of Rogers Corporation sales representatives.

PORONÂ® Polyurethane foams ensure reliability where cushioning, sealing, impact protection or energy management are critical to product performance.

  • Resistance to Stress Relaxation and Compression Set â€“ Durable, long-term performance for gasketing, sealing, and cushioning.
  • Energy Absorption â€“ High resiliency, good vibration isolation and impact absorption.
  • Low Outgassing â€“ No plasticizers to to migrate, non-corrosive to metal, environmentally safe and clean.
  • Broad Temperature Range â€“ Reliable performance from -40ÂºC to 90ÂºC.
  • Chemical Resistance â€“ Information on material exposure to acids, bases, organic fluids, automotive fluids and household fluids.
  • Flame Retardant â€“ Many of the materials meet flammability requirements of UL HBF and MVSS 302.
  • Easy to Fabricate â€“ Die-cuts cleanly and readily accepts adhesive without surface preparation.
  • Product Consistency â€“ Quality manufacturing resulting in reliable, consistent material properties.
  • Broad Product Offering â€“ Wide range of firmness, density, thickness and color options.
  • Quality â€“ All products are supported by knowledgeable Rogers sales Applications Engineers, Technical Service and Customer Service Representatives.

 

BISCOÂ® Silicones are a full line of cellular, solid, and specialty materials produced in roll-stock to be fabricated into gaskets, heat shields, fire stops, seals, cushions and insulation for a wide variety of applications.

BISCOÂ® Silicone materials offer:

  • Superior flame resistance
  • Low flame, smoke and toxicity upon combustion
  • Excellent performance at extreme temperatures
  • Superior resistance to compression set and creep
suppliers.description: Being a preferred converter opens up access to all Rogers materials, with the added benefit of discounts and favorable lead timesâ€”which we pass along to you.
